title: I just started to learn php about 2 months ago. What should I do with it, or what should I make? - Quora

response.answer_text: Build out your website with what you’ve learned. I’m not sure how far you have progressed so I will advise you in a conservative way. Keep it safe at first by not working with a database until you learn more about Validating and Sanitizing user input. SQL Injection can be devastating. You can build out a nice looking website that uses what you’ve learned so far. Depending on your skillset with HTML and CSS will determine how the site looks and feels. You can always use a front end framework like Bootstrap · The world's most popular mobile-first and responsive front-end framework. which comes with a lot of really nice features and is easy to work with. As you continue learning PHP, enhance your website and ultimately, connect it with a database like MySQL. You can also check out either WordPress, Joomla or Drupal which are all CMS’s built with PHP. Or you can check out a PHP Framework like LaravelCodeigniterCakePHPYIISymfonyetc…There are many to choose from so have fun checking them out and seeing which one will deliver what you’re looking for. Happy Coding.

PHP is server-side scripting langauge, that means he can be used to make dynamic web apps, in a practice and learning purpose you can use it for pretty much any projects ( e-commerce, sales app, managment app, mini-blog o social network clone apps ) It’s up to you to choose your starting project as long as you assure this project will make you understand deeper the language and the eco-system, evaluate the pros and cons and know what to do and when to do it. The important is to PRACTICE,practice and practice, mastering a technology requires continuous work, there is no secret potion for that. Enjoy !
